title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Poker Table", March 9, 1937
medium: Graphite and red colored pencil on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower center: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in stamp in graphite, lower center: 8604/F.S.D./ANDERSON, P.S./D./ 3/9/37, 3/15/37, 1, MASTER CR.; inscribed in graphite below perspective drawing, lower center: FELT. (LEATHER IF REVERSED)/POKER TABLE FOR SIX/36" DIA. 27 1/2" HIGH./TOP LEATHER (REVERSIBLE)/ONE POKER TABLE FOR SIX. 36" DIA. - 29" HIGH/ WALNUT - FINISH ALL AROUND/TOP REVERSABLE/ONE SIDE FELT TOP/OTHER SIDE LEATHER TOP; dimensions, instructions, materials in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for poker table for Anderson house. Low, circular table for six players; four straight, squared legs. Top of table in leather on one side, felt on verso. Top surface removeable and reversible. Shallow perimeter space around surface with pockets.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Poker Table", March 9, 1937.
March 9, 1937. Graphite and red colored pencil on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-937.
